website_summaries.verdict: This lightweight lantern is great for lighting dark paths as well as camping picnic tables.
pros: Compact but delivers a bright glow
Lights with match.Fully adjustable light output.Carry or hang with flexible chain handle
One 16.4-ounce Coleman propane cylinder (sold separately) lasts up to 12 hours
cons: Attaching the mantle can be a challenge, so be sure to bring a spare

customer_reviews.title: Great small propane lantern
customer_reviews.text: Bright for its size, seems fuel efficient. Mantles are easy to find. Chain did rust, i did leave it out at night, but not in rain. Dew must have caused the rust. disappointing. I found a nearly perfect storage box for it: Plano Broadhead Box on amazon.
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Single mantle propane lantern
customer_reviews.text: I spend every spring & fall trout fishing the White Mountains in northern AZ, this lantern provides a comfortable amount of light. Typically I use the lantern for 3-4 hours after dark, a single 1# propane tank will last 6 nights. I would order another but the price went up considerable since I purchased this product. The only down side, the mantles are not stocked at the local sporting goods stores. Order enough spares when you find them on line.
customer_reviews.author: D Mill

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy good little light but beware of used items
customer_reviews.text: Works well..that being said I'm a bit disappointed with the used good condition product I took a chance on to save $5.. Have bought other used like new products have been Like New.. this one arrived well packed but had a off brand mantle not the Coleman brand very tightly fitted easy to fall apart if touched. On off knob seemed weak plastic too much play, passes up the off/on spot when lighting or cutting off. Also the metal protecting globe is bent and chipped in a spot.. none of this seems would effect the functionality. Undecided if will exchange it for a actual brand new one seeing these small issues.
customer_reviews.author: SusieQ

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: First order was stopped and returned before it reached me because the shipper broke it so Amazon canceled the order all together without notification. The second replacement arrived days later and it was BARELY usable. I had to take pliers and clamps to it to bend it to the point I could get the glass out. The top was so off in BOTH directions that I had to cut, bend and reweld them so it could open and close. The mantle is so hard to find and expensive on Amazon I had to find a cross reference and buy #3018 mantles from Cabelas where it is 1/10 the price.
customer_reviews.author: Anubis Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Very bright, saves on fuel.
customer_reviews.text: Obviously a two-mantle Coleman propane lantern will provide light. I encourage you to try this option if you don't often run your two-mantle on high. This unit provides great campsite lighting while using significantly less fuel and less resources on mantles. I'm constantly searching for the most fuel-efficient and effective lighting source - propane is absolutely the way to go, and this single-mantle option makes it even more affordable to do so.
customer_reviews.author: MPWintermute

customer_reviews.title: Buy it !!
customer_reviews.text: Using it right now !! Great buy get it !! This pic is lowest setting just enough to light ground but not over power fire. But on high it does the job if wanting light around table for cards etc
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Nice lantern
customer_reviews.text: I like it.Does the job, and put out more than enough light but has much more plastic. The only thing plastic on my older lantern was the knob on the control valve! It takes up much less space than a double mantle and uses half the gas! The #51 mantles are not as popular as the ones used on the double mantle lanterns so stock up on them. Always have several extra mantles on hand. Overall I am pleased with it so far.
customer_reviews.author: RWFTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a 1-man tent & vestibule
customer_reviews.text: I using an "ALPS Mountaineering" 1-man tent while Deer & Elk hunting this fall, and this lantern along with a light-weight fold-out backpacking stove both fit perfectly inside the vestibule. This lantern will replace a "Mighty Lite" lantern I've used for years, but no longer have. Time will tell how it preforms in comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Compact and bright
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for our rafting trip. Put off plenty of light for our small group. Brighter than I thought it would emit. Only two disappointments, dropping my rating down, are the lack of a storage box (we reused a plastic food container) and the difficulty in finding the mantels. I had to get them from eBay to find them in decent quality at a good price. Overall, happy with the purchase. Consider getting a propane bottle stand to keep it from getting knocked over.
customer_reviews.author: R. Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Expected More Light
customer_reviews.text: I own more than several other coleman lanterns and am satisfied with all of them and I understood this being a single mantle lantern it would put out reduced amounts of light, I was a bit underwhelmed when I fired it up, I would say it puts out "just" enough light tp be useful when fishing or camping and that's it. I also picked up a coleman micro lantern at the same time that runs off the butane/propane mix canisters and it blows this away with much brighter and whiter light mostly due to the fuel being burned as they use the same #51 mantles. Consider this a personal light source for fishing/camping at it's best.
customer_reviews.author: T. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for packing👍
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Be sure to order extra mantles with this as they are hard to find. When putting the mantle on I use latex gloves (to prevent oil from your fingers from contaminating the mantle) making sure the openings of the mantle are closer to each other and I don't pre-burn, just open the valve a little and light. Then open the valve to adjust brightness.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great product....small, durable and throws a ton of light
customer_reviews.text: Perfect lamp for camping or power out situations. The flow valve allows you to pick how much light. A the lowest setting it is quiet but still provides a ton of light, almost too much. At the highest setting, light output would be excessive for indoors except in a very large room. The downside of all propane lanterns is harsh light, when burning it produces a very bright light akin to a welding torch which is fine but can be difficult to use close to lamp. If you hang it above you on the handy chain it is almost perfect for lighting a campsite for 10-15 feet around.
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Non-Standard Mantle - Expensive and hard to find
customer_reviews.text: The mantle type is specified in the ad but it isn't obvious this is a non-standard mantle. Hard to find and expensive. Only one comes with the lantern. Otherwise - lantern seems compact and well-made. Looking forward to using it until the sole included mantle gives out.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny Moore

customer_reviews.title: The Mini
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these for years now, they are my favorite lantern. They are cheap, take up less space, are far less cumbersome than the standard sized lanterns, and just as bright. They aren't nearly as breakable either. The only thing that makes them different is that the light shines in all directions rather than being deflected downward, so using it as a table lantern keep that in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Cam D.

customer_reviews.title: Great little lantern
customer_reviews.text: This is about as minimalist as you can get with a propane-powered lantern, which I like due to its great portability and ease of use. It puts out plenty of light for a tent or camper trailer, and is highly convenient and easy to light. Only reason I don't give it five stars is that the mantles are hard to find and difficult to install. Other than that, for the price and convenience it is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Klipspringer

customer_reviews.title: Camp out brighter
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter's Scout BSA troop loved it. Shines a bright light on everything.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WOW. And to think I spent my entire childhood ...
customer_reviews.text: WOW. And to think I spent my entire childhood with two mantle lanterns. The extra light you get from those is minimal compared to this - PLUS it takes up almost zero space, and the reduced bulk means you'll be less likely to break it by accident. I keep it in a sock in the box - trying to convert my friends to this!
customer_reviews.author: NDirish

customer_reviews.title: You'll LOVE this lantern!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy to have my favorite lantern again- I managed to drown my last one after 7 years of rough handling. This time I added the stabilizing base with extending feet so I don't knock it over as much and I fully expect another 7 years!
customer_reviews.author: D. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Portable light.
customer_reviews.text: Great portable lantern. Pro: It's fits just about anywhere in my camping gear. Easy to put on. Convient. Con Not super bright. Overall: Happy worth the portability and compactness as tradeoff to the lower light output.
customer_reviews.author: David Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Great idea! I really like this product
customer_reviews.text: Great idea! I really like this product, puts out plenty of light without filling up your pack or camper, just right!
customer_reviews.author: Steelbreeze

customer_reviews.title: Nice little lantern
customer_reviews.text: I used it for camping solo and it’s enough light for what I was using it for. If you want to have something that brighter than this thing get a two burner mantle. If you want something that can Work in an emergency and don’t have the money for the two burner mantle this works just fine
customer_reviews.author: jacob

customer_reviews.title: Efficient light and heat source
customer_reviews.text: The manufacturer warns against indoor ( or in tent ) use, but I have a battery operated carbon monoxide alarm, and it never went off. If you only want light then an LED lantern would likely have more advantages. but this puts out considerable heat as a bonus. The local Walmart didn't have the mantels, but did have 2 pack of propane tanks reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Gentle Miant

customer_reviews.title: A perfect substitute for a battery powered lantern
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to have to carry extra batteries on a camping trip where we will not have electricity to power the lights in our RV. Was looking for an "old fashioned" white gas lantern but apparently are no longer available. This one should be a great alternative to a gas lantern and will burn much cleaner without the smell of the fumes from the gas.
customer_reviews.author: StanS

customer_reviews.title: Nice Compact Lantern
customer_reviews.text: I have owned several types of lanterns over the years. There are pros and cons between gas and propane styles. The gas ones work longer, but the propane ones are very convenient. This little lantern is great for the weekend camper that doesn't set up a large camp. It projects a good amount of light and is very portable. It is well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry J

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and small. Easy to pack around. Puts out enough light for a small cam. The price is great for the product and it's operational advantages over a larger lantern. I just wish it had a built in igniter
customer_reviews.author: kimberly c hanthorn

customer_reviews.title: Decent but could be safer.
customer_reviews.text: I mean it works, but I sure don’t care for the open flame that comes out of the top.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: better than expected
customer_reviews.text: very high quality easy to get it going. just make sure you dont touch it very hot use chain and give it cool down time before packing it up.coleman product what more do u have to say!!!
customer_reviews.author: Gloria P.

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern
customer_reviews.text: What a good lantern, had larger ones nut this is better, provides great light, easy to light and control brightness. Perfect size
customer_reviews.author: dean

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: procured for emergency use. Works fine but not very bright
customer_reviews.author: stennisdog

customer_reviews.title: Does not give off a good light.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed with the light output even when I used two of the lanterns, but the lantern does pack small. I'll be going back to my Coleman two mantle because I can adjust the light up to a much more useful brightness when I need it, and then I can turn it down to save on propane.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used the other brands and COLEMAN is far superior.
customer_reviews.author: SLS

customer_reviews.title: Was not as bright as I was hoping. We ...
customer_reviews.text: Was not as bright as I was hoping. We do primative camping while hunting and use a large "wall tent". I was hoping it would be bright enough to light the enitre tent... it was not. Had to go to a two mantel lantern.
customer_reviews.author: Cary Beason

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for airplane camping
customer_reviews.text: We took this to our 7 night camp ouy in PR, Flamenco Beach. I have to say it is awesome! We loved how much light it produced coupled with it's portability. I recommend this lantern as a must have and assure you it will perform it's duty when used.
customer_reviews.author: svecherldrs

customer_reviews.title: very cool
customer_reviews.text: the perfect amount of light for telling stories around the fire, personal santern
customer_reviews.author: Underdogs

customer_reviews.title: Yup!
customer_reviews.text: Really convenient little light! Nowhere near as bright as a full sized white gas coleman, but what do you expect?! It's cheap, small, and convenient. I'm an occasional camper, usually going in my car, so it sees occasional, gentle use, but I love the little thing.
customer_reviews.author: M@

customer_reviews.title: Good lantern and heater
customer_reviews.text: Works well for my one person ice fishing shelter. Gives me light and will generally heat it up. The only downfall was that in a bigger shelter it wasn't quite enough light, especially when hanging from the ceiling. It casts quite a shadow and worked better when on the floor. LED's were still used to see our lines.
customer_reviews.author: Tpal926

customer_reviews.title: Nice little lantern if you don't need a lot of light...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, nice little portable lantern. Output appears to be as advertised. Comparing it to a kerosene wick lantern, it's about twice as bright. Compared to the Northstar propane lantern, it's highest output is less than the Northstar's normal 'low' setting. Great if you don't need a ton of light.
customer_reviews.author: JF

customer_reviews.title: easily assembled and works great
customer_reviews.text: Compact, easily assembled and works great. Perfect for hiking, camping and fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and compact
customer_reviews.text: Handy ground camping or in motor home. Always ready to add good light and some heat if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan Alpha

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great little lantern. Colman's replacement for Campingaz which they acquired several years ago.
customer_reviews.author: D L P

customer_reviews.title: Nice amount of light for me
customer_reviews.text: Compact and lightweight. Nice amount of light for me. Uses less fuel! I don't need to light up the entire forest so why waste fuel. This is all I need.
customer_reviews.author: wvkimdavis

customer_reviews.title: Compact and very handy in my ice fishing shelter
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this along with a head lamp that would work in my ice shelter. It is compact and proves to work better than expected. It isn't super bright but along with the head lamp, it works surprisingly well. I actually purchased two of these. The first one was left the ice as I turned it off to cool before storing and then drove off without it. Whoever found it will undoubtedly find it a very handy item.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny A. Weekes

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality control
customer_reviews.text: Arrived bent and the igniter doesn’t work. Otherwise it’d be 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: X

customer_reviews.title: Compact
customer_reviews.text: This is great for car camping. I also have the stove as well. Very durable. I've had mine for five years (this one was a gift) and only had to change the mantle once. Mantles are easy to find in any dept store.
customer_reviews.author: Shilo

customer_reviews.title: Great amount of light!  Great weight
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I was looking for. Small and light weight, but puts off a good amount of light. Used it at the deer lease last weekend, and it was perfect. Not too bright, but enough light to cook and read by.
customer_reviews.author: T. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Good Piece of gear
customer_reviews.text: It's not as bright as I had expected, but that could jus be me. Used it with my 7 year old on a scout trip. One mantle, easy to use, easy to set up, easy to carry. I keep it wrapped in a small towel in the back pack to cushion the glass.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Bear

customer_reviews.title: Versitile Lantern
customer_reviews.text: The size of this lantern makes it easy to store, move, and carry. It gives off decent heat too. I wish the glass was more durable, but there are replcement globes out there. Works great when paired with a stand for propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Very nice little lantern.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and functional like all Coleman products. Plenty of light for its size. Four stars because I haven't used it yet in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis from New Mexico

customer_reviews.title: Bright, compact lamp
customer_reviews.text: This is a great compact and economical lamp. It also plenty bright enough with just one mantle to illuminate a small campsite. The mantles were available at my local Wal-Mart where I bought about 10 just in case they become harder to find later. It's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Cute and functional...
customer_reviews.text: it works as advertised but I'd like a well fitting plastic case for it. I get tired of pulling out Coleman Boxes when we car camp and having to worry about them getting wet. These types of lanterns are just a bit fragile but they work!
customer_reviews.author: R. Salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact for packing
customer_reviews.text: It is compact and easy to light. It does throw a ton of light. The down side is I can not find backup mantels for a reasonable price. I have not yet found a local store that carries the replacement mantels.
customer_reviews.author: JWR

customer_reviews.title: This Lantern will light your way.....
customer_reviews.text: My son says it is a great lantern to have with him as he is enjoys engaging in the activity of camping every year! A guaranteed winner to have as you engage in outdoor activities!
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Compact and bright when small is the order of the day.
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is designed for. Small, compact, bright enough unit around the table or next to tent. Wish it had a piezo or electric start but that would probably add to bulk and price.
customer_reviews.author: d2003m

customer_reviews.title: Small and packable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lantern to use in an emergency kit at home, since we have occasional power outages that last a while. For me, it would be too small to use while camping, but it's great for the use I intended.
customer_reviews.author: MTSOfan

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern and great size for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived on time. I've had one just like this that I've carried over many miles of backpacking. It has always proved to be reliable in all kind of weather conditions. This lantern has a very bright light with just one mantel. I would recommend this to anyone. I've also used this lantern around my home to light up dark outside areas while entertaining. It is a perfect light for any need you may have.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Hall

customer_reviews.title: Excellent lantern!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had it out in the woods yet. But it puts out alot of light-Being smaller than its 2-burner cousins it should last quite a bit longer. Make sure u get a couple of the replacement #51 mantles as not everyone has them. I will buy another shortly!
customer_reviews.author: P. Swift

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for light camp kit
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to make a light weight camping and fishing kit for quick pickup and go type fishing trips. This was perfect for that. Makes enough light to keep a small camp lit up till bedtime. Makes a bit of heat if needed too. Mantle goes on as easy as any Coleman mantle I've ever installed. Uses fuel efficiently lasting several hours on full brightness and up to 10 hours on lowest setting. If you are looking for a light camp lantern this is the one.
customer_reviews.author: Dmac

customer_reviews.title: and easy to pack for lightweight camping
customer_reviews.text: Functional, and easy to pack for lightweight camping. We had an issue with one of them where a leak developed in the base and it melted the plastic.
customer_reviews.author: JTS

customer_reviews.title: Great Lantern
customer_reviews.text: Screws on by hand, comes with cheapy Mantle , The replacement Mantles are much heavier duty , enclosed mantle shrinks aganist the gas tube makes kind of a arc light, new mantle shrinks to a cotton ball size and a better light
customer_reviews.author: Victor

customer_reviews.title: Compact design was exactly what i needed.
customer_reviews.text: It has a difficult mantle but works great. The low flow design provides plenty of light while extending the life of each propane tank.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: awesome
customer_reviews.text: Puts off plenty of light for a single tent, 5 person camp. Fairly quite and nice and small. I am very, very pleased with this and it gives off just enough light that a double mantle is unnecessary
customer_reviews.author: Mark Fabish

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern
customer_reviews.text: We have used this style of lantern while camping out and love it. We camp out between 25 to 30 days a year and are very happy with this, we own several of them!
customer_reviews.author: Deer Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Great little lantern
customer_reviews.text: Is is a small lanter that puts off tons of light. Perfect for backpacking ad camping. I have 2 of these that I use al all camping trips to light the campsite. Reccomemd for anyone who wants a small lantern
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Great little lamp
customer_reviews.text: This single mantle lamp provides plenty of light, runs for more hours than I counted on a 16 oz can, packs great and uses easily available mantles. I have two. Many department and sporting good stores carry replacement globes. Once used, all mantles damage easily. A single mantle lamp saves money.
customer_reviews.author: throrope

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super bright and runs for hours. I just wish there was a clear replacement for the little bag inside. It probably requires a call to Coleman to figure out which ones to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: This is our second lateen easy to store and an adjustable glow
customer_reviews.text: Works great for nighttime light you can set the amount of brightness to fit your need.
customer_reviews.author: Kim Galletta

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this little guy over a year ago and it's perfect for tent lighting, walking with it, doing the dishes or playing a nighly game while camping. I just love it so much that I am ordering a second one.
customer_reviews.author: MRC

customer_reviews.title: I have 2 of them and packed and ready for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of them and packed and ready for camping. When traveling the backcountry and size matters. This is what's needed.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Brandenburger

customer_reviews.title: but super awesome and effective
customer_reviews.text: Not as bright as we had hoped, but super awesome and effective!!
customer_reviews.author: J G

customer_reviews.title: Camping light
customer_reviews.text: I just wanted a light that was simple and worked well and now I have one I will tell all my camping friends.
customer_reviews.author: SuperGlide

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bright, lasts forever, but... the built in ignition system has never worked properly.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: There's no need to make it seem like daylight in a camp site
customer_reviews.text: No complaints. This lantern does what it's supposed to do. I'll never use a regular double mantle lantern again. There's no need to make it seem like daylight in a camp site. This is lighter and more compact, so I'll stick with these!
customer_reviews.author: JackedLobster

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: Coleman always seems to make good quality items seem to work good and stores away easily for a power outage.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Nathan T. Hopper

customer_reviews.title: Coleman One-Mantle Compact Propane Lantern
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for emergency use or camping Name brand product well made good price shipped right away. I recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Coleman One-Mantle Compact Propane Lantern
customer_reviews.text: The advantage of this lantern is that is quite small, so easy to carry in a camping setting. Quality is good, but it is difficult to find the type of mantle that this unit uses, so keep a backup if you decide to buy this unit. Shortly after I received this lantern I found a two mantle Coleman with hard carry case for about $10 more which I subsequently purchased. Live and learn. I hope this information is of help to those considering the purchase of this lantern.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Lights the way
customer_reviews.text: We now have two working lanterns for an emergency and this provides much needed peace of mind for us at home.
customer_reviews.author: Christoph F. Hattoon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Coleman camp gear is the best. small and light weight, easy to use
customer_reviews.author: rob jaeger

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT
customer_reviews.text: This was my second one I have bought. The down side to these lanterns is the mantle that they take is more expensive and harder to find, BUT the regular mantles for other lanterns work with these too!!!! for half the price. With that said these lanterns are great. I just got back from 5 days camping and my lantern I had in the tent ran every night for at least 3 hours on the lowest setting on a half empty tank!!!!!!!!!! I will be buying a couple more. I love these little lanterns.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Henry

customer_reviews.title: Not so bright!!
customer_reviews.text: I won't buy it again! I wanted a small lantern to light up my cooking area while attaching it to my three outlet tree on a five gallon tank. It is not very bright at the highest setting. It puts out a yellowish looking light, which is not so bright for the cost!! My 20 watt bulb at home is brighter than this. Its only good if you want a dim light around the campsite that is compact and lite to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Widdy. Loo

customer_reviews.title: Nice little light device
customer_reviews.text: I have not used a full tank yet so I do not know if this provides long term light per tank but it appears to work well. The mantles are fragile once used.
customer_reviews.author: William Bell

customer_reviews.title: Coleman One-Mantle Propane Lantern
customer_reviews.text: Handy interchangeable bottle provides and excellent light source for emergencies, camping, or backyard gatherings at night around a bond fire or whatever the occasion may be.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: this little lantern works great and is compact,have used it several times with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: larry efurd

customer_reviews.title: propane lantern
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. I also have a Coleman 2 mantle dual fuel lantern, and I love them both. Only giving it 4 stars because mine does not sit perfectly straight when screwed on the propane bottle.. meaning its a little off square. I am sure no one else has noticed, and it does not affect performance, but it bothers me enough that i hold back the last star. Sorry Coleman. Either way, its a great little lantern. The chain hadle is nice, long enough that you wont burn your hand when you are walking around the campground with it.
customer_reviews.author: RLG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This tiny lantern is amazing. It's the right price...order the extra mantles...and you're done!!! Just get it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Worksd great! Just right for me to take bank fishing. I just might get another one for my friend too.
customer_reviews.author: kgboyce7

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great little lantern, it will run all night on one tank of gas.
customer_reviews.author: Medic_pathetic

customer_reviews.title: Bright idea!
customer_reviews.text: THis is a great lantern. Easy to transport and very bright! Highly recommended for the camper. Not good for backpacking as propane canisters get a bit cumbersome to carry in and out!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Great lantern
customer_reviews.text: Great lantern for any use. Patios, camping or when the lights go out. I use it when I'm sitting on my porch late at night.
customer_reviews.author: George Noll

customer_reviews.title: Handy and compact
customer_reviews.text: I love this lantern- good light output, compact and comes w/ carrying chain. One drawback- it's very hard to find mantels for. I visited 5 local stores to find replacement mantels, before I finally found them at Kmart. I recommend buying mantels when ordering this product (to save money on shipping) or check availability locally first. Coleman Mantels #51
customer_reviews.author: S. Walhovd

customer_reviews.title: Compact, lightweight, and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Exactly what you would expect from a Coleman lantern!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Came quickly but when opened Christmas morning the globe was cracked.
customer_reviews.author: Teri Powers

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lite weight lantern and emergency heat supply --keep it in the ATV
customer_reviews.author: Joe Nevada

customer_reviews.title: Accurate Title
customer_reviews.text: This is a very compact lantern. Not huge like other ones. It would be great for car camping or backwoods camping if you are willing to carry the propane canister. Installation of the mantle was easy and as others have said its mantel 51. Mine does not have an piza ignitor so I have to light it manually
customer_reviews.author: A. Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Works great for an arctic oven
customer_reviews.text: This works great hanging from the top of my tent. It brings in a little bit warmth while keeping the small space very bright. It is not as fragile as I expected, and easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: TL

customer_reviews.title: Decent lantern for a low cost
customer_reviews.text: I like this lantern for it's low cost and packability. This doesn't take up much space and is pretty bright. At under $30 it is a great buy and far brighter than a electric lantern of similar value.
customer_reviews.author: Strix Nebulosa

customer_reviews.title: Coleman Mini Lantern/ Gas
customer_reviews.text: What's to say? It's Coleman, to which I've come to expect the best from!!! The little lantern is fantastic, took it camping the first time last weekend and it performed flawlesly! Provides lots of light and easy to store in a small trailer, Thanks Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: dogma

customer_reviews.title: Great Little light
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my ice shanty right size with the bonus of heat Start the first time outside for safety as the silk flames up in the beginning
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very good product
customer_reviews.text: I love this lantern, it runs forever on a tank of fuel and is great!
customer_reviews.author: Jason goetsch

customer_reviews.title: Caution With what you use it with.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with the Century Two-Piece 18-30" Type 1 Safety Post. The nipple at the bottom of the Lantern is shorter than the nipple on the post preventing it from depressing the post valve correctly = no gas to the lantern and failure to light. I do have a knack of fixing things so I place a small washer under the nipple shoulder and was able to lift it enough so it would make proper contact with the tree. Yes it works but not the way it should. works with the little coleman tank just fine.
customer_reviews.author: PPC123

customer_reviews.title: mantle installation
customer_reviews.text: This should come with 2 mantles, so after you tear the first, you can try again. Very difficult for my big fingers to place this tube-like mantle over the top of the rough stamping of the burner without compromising the mantle. I've put a few mantles on lanterns before and they were easy compared to this setup, buy extra mantles.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

product_meta.title: Coleman Gas Lantern | 300 Lumens Compact 1 Mantle Propane Lantern
product_meta.description:
Save space for other gear when you pack the Coleman 300 Lumens Compact 1-Mantle Propane Lantern. No matter where you're headed, the pressure-control regulator provides consistent performance.

AMAZON.COM
The Coleman 5132A700 One-mantle Compact Propane Lantern is the lantern that made camping cozy, at its easiest and most portable. Clean-burning propane fuel provides a soft glow for late-night stories or a beacon to guide you back to camp. This Coleman compact lantern lights with matches and is pressure-regulated for consistent light, regardless of weather. The porcelain ventilators will prevent rusting and help this lantern last you a long time.

 Powered by one 16.4 ounce propane cylinder (not included), this handy little lantern features slip-on mantles and a chain handle that can be used for carrying or hanging.

 Manufacturer Warranty
Limited lifetime warranty
feature_bullets: LUMENS: Up to 300 lumens casts light up to 8 meters
RUNTIME: Up to 11.5 hours on high on one 16.4 oz. propane cylinder (sold separately); lights with matches
PRESSURE REGULATOR: Pressure-control technology provides consistent performance, even in extreme conditions
CUSTOMIZABLE BRIGHTNESS: For precise control and the perfect ambience
METAL GLOBE GUARD: Offers added protection from impacts
CHAIN HANDLE: For easy carrying and convenient hanging

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
